paper_title: Exponential Decay Rate of Linear Port-Hamiltonian Systems. A Multiplier Approach
abstract: In this work, the multiplier method is extended to obtain a general lower bound of the exponential decay rate in terms of the physical parameters for port-Hamiltonian systems in one space dimension with boundary dissipation. The physical parameters of the system may be spatially varying. It is shown that under assumptions of boundary or internal dissipation, the system is exponentially stable. This is established through a Lyapunov function defined through a general multiplier function. Furthermore, an explicit bound on the decay rate in terms of the physical parameters is obtained. The method is applied to a number of examples.
publication_venue: 7 pages, 2 figures, Submitted to IEEE TAC
